lead_paragraph: A federal jury found that metal-on-metal Pinnacle hip implants were defectively designed, and that the company did not warn consumers of the risks.

headline.print_headline: J.&J. Must Pay $1 Billion to 6 Hip Implant Patients
headline.main: Johnson & Johnson Must Pay 6 Implant Patients $1 Billion

snippet: A federal jury found that metal-on-metal Pinnacle hip implants were defectively designed, and that the company did not warn consumers of the risks....
abstract: Federal jury in Dallas, Tex, awards six plaintiffs more than $1 billion in lawsuit against Johnson & Johnson and its DePuy Orthopaedics unit; jurors find metal-on-metal Pinnacle hip implants were defective and companies failed to warn consumers of risks.
